body: How did this part of the character's story make you feel?
How much did you get into the character's head?
Do you have any reflections or similar stories to share after playing this chapter?
Which of the situations did you find the most challenging for Aman?

choices.body: When his sister Jothi confronted him
When his friend Zhihao made fun of him
When he faced his dad’s disappointment (not all endings had this)
When he was treated badly in NS

body: Which of the choices did you find the most challenging for Nadia?

choices.body: Responding to her father’s questions in the car
Deciding how to respond to Gavin in the canteen
Choosing how to answer Chloe's questions about your attire

body: Which of the situations did you find the most challenging for Nadia?

choices.body: Anticipating Gavin's reactions when he saw her dressed in the hijab
Dealing with Chloe's perception that Nadia is advantaged unfairly because of her race
Understanding Azlin's viewpoints and her struggles as a Malay

body: What do you think is Nadia's most significant challenge ahead?

choices.body: Being comfortable with herself (e.g. donning the hijab)
Change how her peers perceive her and other Malays
Navigating and understanding the experiences of other Malays

body: Which character do you most resonate with in the character’s journey?
How do you think the main character is feeling now?
Why did you resonate with that character?
